title: PICS: Snow paints Lesotho's peaks white
text:

Spring has sprung in the Maluti Mountains and frosted flakes have peppered the landscape in a blanked of snow.

Earlier this year we saw Lesotho turn into a winter wonderland. But that was fitting, as it was winter.

Now in mid-spring October, Afriski resort, situated high up in the Drakensberg-Maluti Mountains - located 3050 m above sea-level to be exact - is seeing lots of snowfall. Painting its peaks white.

PICS: Lesotho turns into a winter wonderland after heavy snowfall

Earlier this week, SANI pass leading to the resort was closed to 2x4 vehicles as it was deemed too dangerous to drive it without a 4x4. The roads have since been opened again.
